intro: Lotononis leucoclada, commonly known as the white lotononis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its white to pale yellow flowers bloom in spring, and the plant is often found in open habitats. It is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
